& = \dfrac {6 - (-3)}{8 - (-2)}\rule[-3.5mm]{0pt}{9mm}\\
&\answer{  = \dfrac {9} {10}}\rule[0mm]{0pt}{5.5mm}\\

&\answer{  = -\dfrac {10}{9}}\\
\end{aligned}mL2​​​=−mL1​​1​=−910​​​From (c) (i) we havey=−109x+cy = -\dfrac {10}{9} \,x + cy=−910​x+c. To findcccwe substitute the coordinates of M into the equation (sinceL2L_2L2​passes through M).32=−109(3)+c32=−103+cc=32+103c=296\begin{aligned}

\dfrac 3 2  & = -\dfrac {10}{3} + c\rule[-3.5mm]{0pt}{9mm}\\
c & = \dfrac 3 2 + \dfrac {10} {3}\rule[-3.5mm]{0pt}{9mm}\\
c & = \dfrac {29}{6}\rule[0mm]{0pt}{5.5mm}\\
\end{aligned}23​23​cc​=−910​(3)+c=−310​+c=23​+310​=629​​Hence the equation ofL2L_2L2​isy=−109x+296\begin{aligned}
&\answer{ y = -\dfrac {10} {9}\, x + \dfrac {29}{6}}\end{aligned}​y=−910​x+629​​​
